Analysis: Analyze the distribution of the target variable 'SalePrice' to understand its skewness and potential outliers.
Explore the correlation matrix to identify highly correlated features that might lead to multicollinearity.
Investigate the missing values across features to determine the best strategy for imputation.
Perform a univariate analysis on each feature to understand its distribution and identify any anomalies.
Conduct a multivariate analysis to understand the interaction between different features and their impact on the target variable.
Impute missing values using techniques like mean/median imputation for numeric features and mode imputation for categorical features.
Handle categorical variables by encoding them using methods like one-hot encoding or label encoding.
Normalize or standardize numeric features to ensure they have a similar scale, which can improve model performance.
Remove or flag outliers in the dataset to prevent them from negatively impacting model accuracy.
Split the dataset into training and testing sets to ensure the model's generalization capability.
Create new features by combining existing ones that might provide more predictive power, such as calculating the age of the house at the time of sale.
Bin numeric features into categorical bins to capture non-linear relationships with the target variable.
Use feature selection techniques like Recursive Feature Elimination (RFE) or SelectKBest to reduce dimensionality and improve model performance.
Engineer features based on domain knowledge, such as calculating the total square footage by summing the first and second floor areas.
Transform skewed features using logarithmic or Box-Cox transformation to make their distribution more normal.
Train multiple models (e.g., Linear Regression, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting) and compare their performance to select the best one.
Use cross-validation to ensure the model's robustness and to avoid overfitting.
Tune hyperparameters of the selected model using techniques like Grid Search or Random Search to optimize performance.
Implement early stopping during model training to prevent overfitting and improve generalization.
Evaluate the model using appropriate metrics such as RMSE, MAE, and R-squared to ensure it meets the performance criteria.
